knimeNode.name: CSV Writer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Saves a datatable into a file in csv (comma separated value) format.

fullDescription.intro: This node writes out the datatable coming through its input port into a file. The attribute values are separated by commas.
fullDescription.option: Enter a valid file name or URL. You can also choose a previously selected file from the drop-down list, or select a file from the "Browse..." dialog.
Enter a pattern that will be written out for missing values.
If checked, the column names will be written out in the first line of the output file.

If checked, the column header will not be written when appended to the output file. This is particularly useful when the csv writer is used in a LOOPER node to report results. This option is ignored when the column header is not written anyway or the file append option is unset (see below).
If checked, the row headers will be added to the output, as first item in each row.
If checked, the output is appended to the output file (if it exists). If not checked and the file does exist, the file will be overwritten.
